summary:
Freedom to customize the duration & strength of potions, poisons, food, and ingredients any way you like them, through a convenient MCM menu.

You can also change the price & weight of items, stackability of effects, and other unique settings.
descriptionHtml:
[center][img]http://i.imgur.com/6DMXdCo.jpg[/img]


[size=4][color=Crimson][b]Requires[/b][/color]
[url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/3863][u][color=#ff6600][b]SkyUI[/b][/color][/u][/url][/size][/center]



[color=DeepSkyBlue][size=3][b]Some things you can do with this mod:[/b][/size][/color][b]

[color=#313131]                     [/color][color=DeepSkyBlue]*[/color][color=#313131] [/color]Make smithing, enchanting, waterbreathing, & invisibility potions last up to 30x longer.

[color=#313131]                     [/color][color=DeepSkyBlue]*[/color][color=#313131] [/color]Adjust prices of potions, poisons, ingredients & food up or down using a highly customizable formula.

[color=#313131]                     [/color][color=DeepSkyBlue]*[/color][color=#313131] [/color]Transform one-use potions into long-term utility potions. Make Fortify Lockpicking or Fortify Carry Weight last
[color=#313131]                        [/color]all day instead of only for a few moments, and lower the strength of their effects to balance this change.

[color=#313131]                     [/color][color=DeepSkyBlue]*[/color][color=#313131] [/color]Trade in your collection of feeble Frostbite Venoms for something that actually does some damage.

[color=#313131][b][color=#313131]                     [/color][/b][/color][color=DeepSkyBlue]*[/color][color=#313131] [/color]Finally put those Fear & Frenzy poisons to use, by making them affect a more reasonable level of enemies.

[color=#313131][b][color=#313131]                     [/color][/b][/color][color=DeepSkyBlue]*[/color][color=#313131] [/color]Lower the strength of any type of ingredients that you think are too overpowered in the game.

[color=#313131]                     [/color][color=DeepSkyBlue]*[/color][color=#313131] [/color]Scale the weight of ingredients or crafted potions & poisons to be dependent on your Alchemy level -
[color=#313131]                        [/color]reaching lower weights as your skill improves, and using a custom range of values you can set yourself.

[color=#313131]                     [/color][color=DeepSkyBlue]*[/color]Turn instant healing potions or instant damage poisons into restore/damage-over-time effects instead.
[/b]


[b][color=DeepSkyBlue][size=3]Check Out SinitarGaming's review of this mod![/size] (starts ~9:50)[/color][/b]

                    [youtube]_bimRcQdfek[/youtube]

[size=3]
[color=DeepSkyBlue][b]Features & Details:[/b][/color][/size]
[b]
[color=#313131]                    [/color][color=DeepSkyBlue]* [/color]Easy-to-use MCM menu for customizing the duration and strength of potions, poisons, ingredients, and
[color=#313131]                      [/color]food. The weight and gold value of items is also adjustable, and you can change whether any type of
[b][color=#313131]                      [/color][/b]effect will stack or not. Support for every potion, poison, ingredient, and food item that exists!

[color=DeepSkyBlue][b][color=#313131]                   [/color][/b]* [/color]Set potion, poison, ingredient, & food effects to last for any duration that you would like. Usually
                      there is some tradeoff - increase duration, and the strength of effects lowers slightly, & vice-versa. Certain
                      limits have been added to prevent completely overpowered settings, but the possibilities are pretty wide.
[color=#4d4d4d]                      (there's also a secret way to completely "unlock" these limits, hidden in the MCM menu, if you can find it)[/color]
[color=DeepSkyBlue] 
                   * [/color]Full support for all Vanilla and DLC potions, ingredients, and food (but no DLCs required to use the mod).
[color=DeepSkyBlue]
                   * [/color]Full support for new potions, ingredients, and food items [i]added by any other mod![/i]
[color=DeepSkyBlue]
                   * [/color]Ultimate potions & The White Phial's restore effect are untouched by the mod, both still heal you instantly.
[color=DeepSkyBlue]
                   * [/color]For Restore-type effects, if an item's total strength is less than the duration you've set, it will have a
                      shorter duration. Horker Meat is an example: Even with Restore Health for food set to 60 seconds,
                      since Horker Meat only restores 5 health points, it only lasts 5 seconds, healing one point per second.
[color=DeepSkyBlue]
                   * [/color]Note: settings are not saved in your savegame file due to engine limitations, but all your settings
                      will be restored to your preferences within 2-3 seconds after loading the savefile.


[/b][color=DeepSkyBlue][b]                               ~~ [/b][/color]Check out all the screenshots to get a better sense of how the menu & options work! [color=DeepSkyBlue][b] ~
[/b][/color][color=#c0c0c0]                                                   (haven't updated them for 3.1 yet, but many features are still shown)[/color]




[color=DeepSkyBlue][b][size=3]How To Enable Custom Presets[/size]
[/b][/color]
[b]The mod now supports custom re-loadable presets! You can save every detail of your entire MCM setup,
and then load your presets for different characters or even when you start a completely new game.

[color=Lime]~ Instructions ~
[/color][/b][color=Lime]   *[/color]Download the [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/48265][u][color=#00e38c][b]FISS Plugin[/b][/color][/u][/url] for SKSE
[color=Lime]   *[/color]Enable [b]FISS.esp[/b] in your mod load order.
[color=Lime]   *[/color]Dynamic Potions will automatically recognize FISS, and a new [color=#00e38c][b]"Presets"[/b][/color] page will appear in the MCM
[color=Lime]   *[/color]You can now save, load, and rename your custom presets!




[color=DeepSkyBlue][size=3][b]Installation & Compatibility
[/b][/size][/color]
[b][color=DeepSkyBlue]     * [/color]Use any mod manager or place files in your Data directory. The mod takes 2-3 minutes to install in game,
        A message will appear in the upper left corner of your screen when the mod has finished installing.
[color=DeepSkyBlue]
     * [/color]Easy Uninstallation through the MCM menu.
[color=DeepSkyBlue]
     * [/color]For the best experience, install Dynamic Potions [i]at the same time or later than[/i] all other mods that
        change potion/food/ingredient effects. DP will base many future decisions on the effects as they
        exist when it is first installed. (You can always reinstall it to force the re-evaluation of effects)
[color=DeepSkyBlue]
     * [/color]This mod should be compatible with anything, even other potion/alchemy mods. (However, DP will not
        change RnD food effects, since they are customized. You can probably trick DP into altering them
        though, by installing Dynamic Potions first on a save that hasn't seen RnD, and then installing RnD after.)
[color=DeepSkyBlue]
     * [/color]There is an Item Tracking option in the mod's MCM menu, which I recommend enabling if you are using
        any mods that add new items to the game. It will enable a very lightweight script that recognizes any
        new items you pick up. This will not have any noticeable impact on your gameplay. If you leave this
        option turned off, the mod will not be running any scripts at all during normal gameplay.
[color=DeepSkyBlue]
     * [/color]If you are playing with other mods that alter durations or other attributes of particular items, and
        would like to keep those settings, just disable those particular sliders in the Dynamic Potions
        menu. Dynamic potions will not make any changes to items whose sliders are disabled in the MCM.
[/b]



[b][size=3][color=#882fdd]          Special thanks to [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/users/2618334/?tb=mods&pUp=1]Hypno[/url] for designing the old v2 MCM logo![/color]

[color=#882fdd]          You may like my other mod: [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/42796]Enchanting Awakened[/url][/color][/size][/b]



[img]http://static-1.nexusmods.com/15/mods/110/images/47521-1-1384976103.jpg[/img]
author: egocarib

files.name: 8 - Dynamic Potions
files.changelogHtml:
Dynamic Potions - Version 2
++++++++++++++++++++++++++++

-Added weight sliders to adjust the weight of potions, ingredients, and food in addition to their duration and potency.

-Improved the MCM interface to be a bit nicer, and also made it possible to disable item settings so that the mod no longer tracks/changes particular items.

-Some performance optimizations, particularly for speeding things up on game load (the mod now updates everything found in the player's inventory first).

-Improved inventory handling, should no longer be necessary to drop/re-add custom items from other mods upon installing for them to be recognized, inventory is checked.

-Added the ability to turn off the item tracker entirely, to disable scripts during gameplay while still getting all the benefits of the mod.

-Added an "Update Inventory" button, which you can use while item tracking is disabled to manually re-evaluate your inventory and recognize any custom items.

files.name: 9 - Dynamic Potions - No Stacking Effects
files.changelogHtml:
Dynamic Potions - Version 2
++++++++++++++++++++++++++++

-Added weight sliders to adjust the weight of potions, ingredients, and food in addition to their duration and potency.

-Improved the MCM interface to be a bit nicer, and also made it possible to disable item settings so that the mod no longer tracks/changes particular items.

-Some performance optimizations, particularly for speeding things up on game load (the mod now updates everything found in the player's inventory first).

-Improved inventory handling, should no longer be necessary to drop/re-add custom items from other mods upon installing for them to be recognized, inventory is checked.

-Added the ability to turn off the item tracker entirely, to disable scripts during gameplay while still getting all the benefits of the mod.

-Added an "Update Inventory" button, which you can use while item tracking is disabled to manually re-evaluate your inventory and recognize any custom items.

files.name: 1 - Dynamic Potions
files.changelogHtml:
Version 3.2
==============
- Reverse-engineered the vanilla price calculation formula so that I could stabilize crafted potion prices that were soaring to unbelievable levels. All potions should now maintain the same exact price no matter what settings you choose for duration, power, or anything else. (unless of course you adjust their prices in the MCM)


Version 3.11
==============
The stacking options in 3.1 did not work because I forgot to rename a few important functions. (you may have noticed a few log errors because of this, but they're nothing to worry about). Downloading 3.11 will retroactively fix the problem and properly enable stacking options.

While I was at it, I also fixed the issue where loading old preset files from the previous version would give you an error message - they should load without any errors now.


Version 3.1
==============
* You can now toggle whether every type of effect is stackable or non-stackable
* You can now completely customize the price of potions, poisons, food, and ingredients using a unique formula
* I have fixed crafted potions so that they will remember their weight correctly. (Only affects new ones you create)
* This means the "scale crafted potion weight to level" feature now works as intended, changing gradually over time
* MASSIVE speed improvements. We're talking like, 98.5% faster than previous. Everything is utterly instantaneous, scripts only run the first 2-3 seconds after you load a save.
* The performance increase is because I learned to shift a lot of the work over to an SKSE plugin (SKSE 1.7.0 now required)
* Unofficial Skyrim Patch Changes properly integrated into the mod now (Poison Resist now applies to a few more effects)
* Fixed White Phial "0 seconds" description error.
* Make sure to update FISS if using presets, I took out the code that prevented buggy behavior with older FISS versions.
* Probably some other stuff I'm forgetting was also fixed.

files.name: Dynamic Potions
files.changelogHtml:
Version 3.21
====================
- Fixed custom potions/ingredients being reduced to zero gold value
- Fixed weight error for cooked items (and anything else that was crafted but not a "true" ingredient-mixed potion)
- Fixed the special MCM option to "Link Poisons & Ingredients" - this will now work correctly just like the link potions/ingredients option
- Uploaded a new optional presets file with one new preset added (thanks to Arkngt! He said it is an OOO-style preset)

NOTE: If you have already suffered the zero gold value or the weight editing bug, you will most likely need to re-install the mod for the fix to take effect. (Choose the uninstall option from the MCM menu, then exit the game and fully uninstall the mod. Boot up Skyrim and make a clean save without the mod loaded. Then you can exit again, re-install the new version, and things will be fixed.)

files.name: - Presets -
files.changelogHtml:
Version 3.21
====================
- Fixed custom potions/ingredients being reduced to zero gold value
- Fixed weight error for cooked items (and anything else that was crafted but not a "true" ingredient-mixed potion)
- Fixed the special MCM option to "Link Poisons & Ingredients" - this will now work correctly just like the link potions/ingredients option
- Uploaded a new optional presets file with one new preset added (thanks to Arkngt! He said it is an OOO-style preset)

NOTE: If you have already suffered the zero gold value or the weight editing bug, you will most likely need to re-install the mod for the fix to take effect. (Choose the uninstall option from the MCM menu, then exit the game and fully uninstall the mod. Boot up Skyrim and make a clean save without the mod loaded. Then you can exit again, re-install the new version, and things will be fixed.)
